strapiPost.title: Parking Reform In Fayetteville Gives New Life To Old Buildings
strapiPost.content:
Before Feed and Folly became one of the coolest rooftop bars in Fayettville, the building on S College Ave sat vacant for almost 40 years due to commercial parking requirements that rendered the space unusable.

  • Renewed: Feed and Folly is just one success story resulting from Fayetteville's decision to remove commercial parking requirements citywide that formerly made spaces like this impossible to redevelop.
  • Priorities: Another benefit of eliminating parking minimums citywide has been reducing time spent processing parking variances and freeing up city staff to work on more important matters.

Read the full article by Congress for New Urbanism HERE.
